The burden<S>4853</S> of Egypt<S>4714</S>. Behold, the LORD<S>3068</S> rideth<S>7392</S> upon a swift<S>7031</S> cloud<S>5645</S>, and shall come<S>935</S> into Egypt<S>4714</S>: and the idols<S>457</S> of Egypt<S>4714</S> shall be moved<S>5128</S> at his presence<S>6440</S>, and the heart<S>3824</S> of Egypt<S>4714</S> shall melt<S>4549</S> in the midst<S>7130</S> of it.
And I will set<S>5526</S> the Egyptians<S>4714</S> against the Egyptians<S>4714</S>: and they shall fight<S>3898</S> every one<S>376</S> against his brother<S>251</S>, and every one<S>376</S> against his neighbour<S>7453</S>; city<S>5892</S> against city<S>5892</S>, and kingdom<S>4467</S> against kingdom<S>4467</S>. <sup>set: Heb. mingle</sup>
And the spirit<S>7307</S> of Egypt<S>4714</S> shall fail<S>1238</S> in the midst<S>7130</S> thereof; and I will destroy<S>1104</S> the counsel<S>6098</S> thereof: and they shall seek<S>1875</S> to the idols<S>457</S>, and to the charmers<S>328</S>, and to them that have familiar spirits<S>178</S>, and to the wizards<S>3049</S>. <sup>fail: Heb. be emptied</sup> <sup>destroy: Heb. swallow up</sup>
And<S>853</S> the Egyptians<S>4714</S> will I give over<S>5534</S> into the hand<S>3027</S> of a cruel<S>7186</S> lord<S>113</S>; and a fierce<S>5794</S> king<S>4428</S> shall rule<S>4910</S> over them, saith<S>5002</S> the Lord<S>113</S>, the LORD<S>3068</S> of hosts<S>6635</S>. <sup>give: or, shut up</sup>
And the waters<S>4325</S> shall fail<S>5405</S> from the sea<S>3220</S>, and the river<S>5104</S> shall be wasted<S>2717</S> and dried up<S>3001</S>.
And they shall turn<S>2186</S> the rivers<S>5104</S> far away<S>2186</S>; and the brooks<S>2975</S> of defence<S>4693</S> shall be emptied<S>1809</S> and dried up<S>2717</S>: the reeds<S>7070</S> and flags<S>5488</S> shall wither<S>7060</S>.
The paper reeds<S>6169</S> by the brooks<S>2975</S>, by the mouth<S>6310</S> of the brooks<S>2975</S>, and every thing sown<S>4218</S> by the brooks<S>2975</S>, shall wither<S>3001</S>, be driven away<S>5086</S>, and be no more. <sup>and be: Heb. and shall not be</sup>
The fishers<S>1771</S> also shall mourn<S>578</S>, and all they that cast<S>7993</S> angle<S>2443</S> into the brooks<S>2975</S> shall lament<S>56</S>, and they that spread<S>6566</S> nets<S>4365</S> upon<S>6440</S> the waters<S>4325</S> shall languish<S>535</S>.
Moreover they that work<S>5647</S> in fine<S>8305</S> flax<S>6593</S>, and they that weave<S>707</S> networks<S>2355</S>, shall be confounded<S>954</S>. <sup>networks: or, white works</sup>
And they shall be broken<S>1792</S> in the purposes<S>8356</S> thereof, all that make<S>6213</S> sluices<S>7938</S> and ponds<S>99</S> for fish<S>5315</S>. <sup>purposes: Heb. foundations</sup> <sup>for fish: Heb. of living things</sup>
Surely the princes<S>8269</S> of Zoan<S>6814</S> are fools<S>191</S>, the counsel<S>6098</S> of the wise<S>2450</S> counsellors<S>3289</S> of Pharaoh<S>6547</S> is become brutish<S>1197</S>: how say<S>559</S> ye unto Pharaoh<S>6547</S>, I am the son<S>1121</S> of the wise<S>2450</S>, the son<S>1121</S> of ancient<S>6924</S> kings<S>4428</S>?
Where<S>335</S> are they? where<S>645</S> are thy wise<S>2450</S> men? and let them tell<S>5046</S> thee now, and let them know<S>3045</S> what the LORD<S>3068</S> of hosts<S>6635</S> hath purposed<S>3289</S> upon Egypt<S>4714</S>.
The princes<S>8269</S> of Zoan<S>6814</S> are become fools<S>2973</S>, the princes<S>8269</S> of Noph<S>5297</S> are deceived<S>5377</S>; they have also seduced<S>8582</S> Egypt<S>4714</S>, even they that are the stay<S>6438</S> of the tribes<S>7626</S> thereof. <sup>they that: or, governors: Heb. corners</sup>
The LORD<S>3068</S> hath mingled<S>4537</S> a perverse<S>5773</S> spirit<S>7307</S> in the midst<S>7130</S> thereof: and they have caused Egypt<S>4714</S> to err<S>8582</S> in every work<S>4639</S> thereof, as a drunken<S>7910</S> man staggereth<S>8582</S> in his vomit<S>6892</S>. <sup>a perverse: Heb. a spirit of perversities</sup>
Neither shall there be any work<S>4639</S> for Egypt<S>4714</S>, which the head<S>7218</S> or tail<S>2180</S>, branch<S>3712</S> or rush<S>100</S>, may do<S>6213</S>.
In that day<S>3117</S> shall Egypt<S>4714</S> be like unto women<S>802</S>: and it shall be afraid<S>2729</S> and fear<S>6342</S> because<S>6440</S> of the shaking<S>8573</S> of the hand<S>3027</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> of hosts<S>6635</S>, which he shaketh<S>5130</S> over it.
And the land<S>127</S> of Judah<S>3063</S> shall be a terror<S>2283</S> unto Egypt<S>4714</S>, every one that maketh mention<S>2142</S> thereof shall be afraid<S>6342</S> in himself, because<S>6440</S> of the counsel<S>6098</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> of hosts<S>6635</S>, which he hath determined<S>3289</S> against it.
In that day<S>3117</S> shall five<S>2568</S> cities<S>5892</S> in the land<S>776</S> of Egypt<S>4714</S> speak<S>1696</S> the language<S>8193</S> of Canaan<S>3667</S>, and swear<S>7650</S> to the LORD<S>3068</S> of hosts<S>6635</S>; one<S>259</S> shall be called<S>559</S>, The city<S>5892</S> of destruction<S>2041</S>. <sup>the language: Heb. the lip</sup> <sup>of destruction: or, of Heres, or, of the sun</sup>
In that day<S>3117</S> shall there be an altar<S>4196</S> to the LORD<S>3068</S> in the midst<S>8432</S> of the land<S>776</S> of Egypt<S>4714</S>, and a pillar<S>4676</S> at<S>681</S> the border<S>1366</S> thereof to the LORD<S>3068</S>.
And it shall be for a sign<S>226</S> and for a witness<S>5707</S> unto the LORD<S>3068</S> of hosts<S>6635</S> in the land<S>776</S> of Egypt<S>4714</S>: for they shall cry<S>6817</S> unto the LORD<S>3068</S> because<S>6440</S> of the oppressors<S>3905</S>, and he shall send<S>7971</S> them a saviour<S>3467</S>, and a great one<S>7227</S>, and he shall deliver<S>5337</S> them.
And the LORD<S>3068</S> shall be known<S>3045</S> to Egypt<S>4714</S>, and the Egyptians<S>4714</S> shall know<S>3045</S> the LORD<S>3068</S> in that day<S>3117</S>, and shall do<S>5647</S> sacrifice<S>2077</S> and oblation<S>4503</S>; yea, they shall vow<S>5087</S> a vow<S>5088</S> unto the LORD<S>3068</S>, and perform<S>7999</S> it.
And the LORD<S>3068</S> shall smite<S>5062</S> Egypt<S>4714</S>: he shall smite<S>5062</S> and heal<S>7495</S> it: and they shall return<S>7725</S> even to the LORD<S>3068</S>, and he shall be intreated<S>6279</S> of them, and shall heal<S>7495</S> them.
In that day<S>3117</S> shall there be a highway<S>4546</S> out of Egypt<S>4714</S> to Assyria<S>804</S>, and the Assyrian<S>804</S> shall come<S>935</S> into Egypt<S>4714</S>, and the Egyptian<S>4714</S> into Assyria<S>804</S>, and the Egyptians<S>4714</S> shall serve<S>5647</S> with the Assyrians<S>804</S>.
In that day<S>3117</S> shall Israel<S>3478</S> be the third<S>7992</S> with Egypt<S>4714</S> and with Assyria<S>804</S>, even a blessing<S>1293</S> in the midst<S>7130</S> of the land<S>776</S>:
Whom the LORD<S>3068</S> of hosts<S>6635</S> shall bless<S>1288</S>, saying<S>559</S>, Blessed<S>1288</S> be Egypt<S>4714</S> my people<S>5971</S>, and Assyria<S>804</S> the work<S>4639</S> of my hands<S>3027</S>, and Israel<S>3478</S> mine inheritance<S>5159</S>.
